\h(«Polly»)This place isn't bad. It sort of reminds me
of my tavern back on Sailors' Island.\e
\h(«Polly»)I think I'll be able to cook here… \e

\h(«Polly»)But, the kitchen could use a little work.
It needs some remodeling if I'm going to make
some of my more popular dishes.\c

\h(«Polly»)If you let me remodel the place, I'll be able 
to open a tavern here on your island.\c

\h(«Pinta»)This is a really nice island! It's even in a 
great location, too! We should be able to go on 
all sorts of adventures from here.\e

\h(«Marco»)I never thought that I would ever be able to get
out of Valua. And I never knew the outside world
was so big!\e

\h(«Marco»)After your little pep talk, I've been wanting to
see as much of the world as I can. Thanks, Vyse!
I can't wait to go sailing again!\c

\h(«Marco»)Heh… The biggest surprise for me after getting 
out of Valua was probably the sky… It's blue. 
I've never seen a blue sky before…\e

\h(«Marco»)And the clouds are white! I thought they were 
all dark like the ones in Valua!\e

\h(«Marco»)Hey, don't laugh! If you lived in Lower City 
your whole life, you'd understand!\c
\h(«Marco»)So, how's the ship's new engine doing?\e

\h(«Marco»)Heh… Who'd have thought that I'd become an
engineer… I actually helped build that thing!
I did a pretty good job if I do say so myself.\c

\h(«Marco»)Welcome back, Vyse! I bet you were surprised to
find the island all fixed up, weren't you?\e

\h(«Marco»)I helped Izmael a lot, too! Okay, well… I only 
painted the walls, but it was still a lot 
of work!\c

\h(«Marco»)Hey, you guys saw the shooting stars that 
were falling over Valua, right?\e

\h(«Marco»)Ever since that happened, you and Aika have 
been looking pretty upset. What's up? Did 
something bad happen?\c

\h(«Marco»)The Armada made the Moon Stones fall on Valua,
huh?\e

\h(«Marco»)I… I didn't really like the place, but… I grew
up there. It makes me sad that it's all gone.\e

\h(«Marco»)Vyse, promise me that we'll beat the Armada. 
We can't let them get away with what they've
done.\c

\h(«Marco»)We have to stop them before they destroy all 
of the other lands. There's so much I haven't
seen yet.\c

known…\e

your food well before swallowing!\e

\h(«Kalifa»)That way you won't choke on it, and it
also aids the digestion process.\c

“Swashbuckler Rating” will affect your mission!\e

\h(«Kalifa»)When you have a low rating, it will become
easier to run from fights and easier to avoid
them all together!\c

tomorrow will be partly cloudy and there is
chance of rain in some areas.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)So, if you have any laundry out to dry, you
better bring it inside today!\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! Having a high
“Swashbuckler Rating” will affect the morale
of your crew in a positive manner.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)Your bravery will show through in battle,
as well! Your fighting abilities will raise
depending on your ability as a leader!\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! On… Pirate Isle…
the little girl named Lindsi… Oh, no! She will
be playing on the dock and… and…\e

\h(«Kalifa»)… and she's going to get a splinter
in her finger!\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! A woman from a tavern
and a man who sits alone in silence will be
reunited!\e

\h(«Kalifa»)And they will live happily ever after once 
they are together again as husband and wife. 
Such a happy ending…\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! 
Your lucky number is 4. 
Your lucky color is… umm… blue.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)Couples should spend more time outdoors!
Fresh air and beautiful scenery can be 
invigorating…\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! On Sailors' Island,
there are some rare items for sale.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)So, be sure to check back there as often as
possible to see what new wares are in the
merchants' possession!\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! You will meet many
people during your travels. You will also part
with many people…\e

\h(«Kalifa»)…What? You say that could be anyone's fortune?!
Skeptic! You must learn to accept your own fate.
Then you will learn your true purpose.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! In this world, there
are 3 special Chams called “Abirik Chams.”\e

\h(«Kalifa»)You never know where you'll get them from, so
make sure to be nice to people… they may
surprise you with a gift.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Defensive techniques only last for one round,
but their effect is guaranteed.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)So, if you can anticipate your enemies' moves,
you will be able to render their attacks
ineffective.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! Once you are the
captain of your own ship and your Spirits
are as high as they can be…\e

\h(«Kalifa»)You will gain the power to call forth all of
your allies to battle by your side.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! Your crew will react
differently depending on the condition of your
ship.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)Once you have a crew, talk to them often.
Especially when all seems lost.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! If you want to
make your cannons more effective, seek out
a “Gunner” for your crew.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)On the other hand, if you wish to increase the
defensive power of your ship, then you should
find an “Engineer” to help maintain it.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! Princess Moegi will 
find love. But that love will cause her great
pain.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)I… I cannot see more. The future hangs in the
balance. You must be strong, for you carry the
fate of the world on your shoulders.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! If you always stand
your ground in a fight, word will spread
amongst the people of your bravery.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)On the other hand, if you always flee from your
adversaries, the people will learn of your
cowardice. Be careful in your actions.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something! When a Moon Stone 
becomes contaminated, it becomes a “Chom.”
They have the opposite effect as “Chams.”\e

\h(«Kalifa»)Giving Cupil a Chom will result in him
regurgitating all of the Chams that he has eaten
up until that point. Use them wisely.\c

avoid eating fish at all costs!\e

\h(«Kalifa»)If you do, it will upset your stomach and you
will feel a sickness many times worse than that
caused by air travel.\c
\h(«Kalifa»)… Nothing. I see nothing.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)Well, just consider the gold that you spent as
an investment in your future.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something!

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something!\e

\h(«Kalifa»)Ancient wisdom will fall because of 
what a young heart feels.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something!
I see great danger in your immediate future!\e

\h(«Kalifa»)A great evil takes many shapes, 
but in reality… it has none.
That is all I can say, for now.\c

But it is cloudy… Perhaps another 10 gold 
tomorrow will clear things up!\e

\h(«Kalifa»)Hey, fortune tellers have to eat too, you know.
\c

I see a Moon Stone! But, its color is…\e

\h(«Kalifa»)Hard to see. It's not red. Nor is it purple, 
blue, or green. Nor is it yellow, or silver. 
It's a color that I've never seen.\c
\h(«Kalifa»)Yes, yes! I see something!\e

\h(«Kalifa»)There is more to Deep Sky than meets the eye!
Use caution Vyse, there is great evil under the
clouds.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)The Red Moon has spoken. Remember it always and 
the way will be clear to you.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)I'm very sorry, but you don't have enough gold. 
Come back again later.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)I see… very well. If you ever need the guidance
of the Red Moon, do not hesitate to return.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Remember my words and heed them carefully.
Now go forth and fulfill your destiny.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)By the way, can you do something with this tent?
It's awfully hard to concentrate in such… 
austere surroundings.\c

\h(«Merida»)I have heard that the royal family of Valua is
cruel, and the people of Valua are cold-hearted.\e

\h(«Merida»)But Enrique is so nice. Marco is cute, too. I
think that it is wrong to judge people just
because they come from somewhere else.\c

\h(«Hans»)I'm learning all about shipbuilding from Brabham
right now.\e

\h(«Hans»)Brabham is an expert on all kinds of engines, 
from old models to new models, so I've learned
a lot from him! My father would be proud!\e

\h(«Hans»)He let me read the Yafutoman Book 
on Ship Polarity.\e

\h(«Hans»)From that, I learned how to build an engine 
using wave motion technology and how to arrange
the sails when flying at extreme heights!\c

\h(«Hans»)The Great Cloud Sea Engine was quite a job. And 
Brabham is so strict when it comes to work.\e

\h(«Hans»)He must be tired from all those sleepless 
nights, but he doesn't show it.  He is so 
energetic, especially for his age!\e

\h(«Hans»)Well, our base is as good as ever.
Now, we just have to prepare for the
assault on Valua.\e

\h(«Hans»)Did you notice, during the attack, how fast some
of their ships were? Or even that one ship that
was able to fly beneath the clouds?\e

\h(«Hans»)I wonder why the Valuans only use their 
superior technology to kill people…\c

\h(«Hans»)Vyse…
It's time for the final battle…\e

\h(«Hans»)My father's ship, the Ironclad, is ready 
for action, too!\e

\h(«Hans»)We have finished working on the Delphinus. 
It is ready when you are!\c

see the entire island from up here?\e

fact that Izmael ate Brabham's lunch when he
wasn't looking.\c

Princess Moegi seems to be going to the pond

you were going in that little boat, but…\e

even with my eagle-like eyes.\e

\h(«Tikatika»)But, I can sense the fear of the birds that come

\h(«Don»)When I heard this place used to be a desert
island, I figured it would be even more 
depressing than Esparanza.\e

\h(«Don»)But, you've got a good variety of food and 
drinks here, and you've assembled quite a crew. 
You're doing a great job!\c

\h(«Don»)Into Deep Sky, huh? I couldn't even make it 
through the Dark Rift. Now I'm about to sail 
into the underworld with you.\e

\h(«Don»)Vyse, I gotta tell ya. There's never a dull 
moment when you're around. To say that you are 
inspirational would be an understatement.\e

\h(«Don»)We all would have made it through the Dark Rift 
if you were around back then.\c

\h(«Don»)Hey, I really want to hear about the Great
Silver Shrine!\e

\h(«Don»)While you were off adventuring, I was bustin' 
my butt working on these buildings.\c

\h(«Don»)Hey, something happened to the Yellow Moon. 
It rained Moon Stones on Valua. Then there were
some explosions.\e

\h(«Don»)I want to put my past behind me, but 
I'm worried about the Valuans. 
They're not all bad, you know.\c

\h(«Don»)So, this is it, huh?  
If we all make it back, 
we're going to celebrate!\e
\h(«Don»)I got my bottle of loqua ready!\e
\h(«Don»)Let's get 'em, Vyse!\c

Captain Vyse… I like the sound of that.\e

\h(«Aika»)You've sailed around the world in your own ship!
Not many people can say that they've made their
childhood dreams come true, you know.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Aika, you make it sound like I'm ready to
retire. There's still so much that I haven't
seen yet.\e

\h(«Vyse»)And there's still lots of undiscovered treasure 
to be found. We've got a long way to go!\e

\h(«Aika»)Haha, that's so like you! Don't worry, 
I'll be right there with you! Especially 
if there's treasure involved.\c

\h(«Aika»)I'll do my best, Captain Vyse. Haha… 
I like the sound of that. It makes me laugh.\c

\h(«Aika»)Vyse, now that we can go higher and lower than 
we ever have before, we can explore all of the 
places where we haven't been yet!\c

\h(«Aika»)Brabham should be finished working on the
Delphinus by now!\e
\h(«Aika»)Let's hurry back to the port, Vyse!\c

\h(«Aika»)I was going to start calling Enrique 
'Prince Pukey,' because he was always 
barfing over the side of the ship…\e
\h(«Aika»)But now, he's become quite a sailor!\e
\h(«Aika»)He'll be okay… Right, Vyse…?\c

\h(«Aika»)When we were kids, remember how everyone
used to describe Deep Sky as a cold, 
dark place where the dead went to rest?\e

\h(«Aika»)I didn't want to believe that my mom and dad 
went to such a horrible place after they died…\e

\h(«Aika»)So, I promised myself that someday, I 
would travel to Deep Sky and see it for 
myself. I wanted to prove everyone wrong.\c

\h(«Aika»)I hope Fina is okay…
She says she is, 
but she looks really sad… \e

\h(«Aika»)Wasn't Elder Prime like a grandfather to her?
Losing him must have been really hard on her.\c

\h(«Aika»)I never thought Galcian would actually 
use the Rains of Destruction!\e

\h(«Aika»)And he did it on his own country, too! 
I can't believe how many people he killed. 
We have to find a way to stop him!\c

\h(«Aika»)So, it all comes down to this battle…
I was really nervous last night, and I didn't
get much sleep.\e

\h(«Aika»)At first, I was scared, but when I thought
about all of the Air Pirates that are here to
fight with us, I started to feel better.\e

\h(«Aika»)Alright, Vyse, everyone's waiting for us at the
Delphinus! Let's hurry back to the port!\c

\h(«Aika»)We really should head back to the Delphinus! 
Everyone is awaiting your orders!\c

\h(«Aika»)Good morning, Vyse!
Thanks for that little talk last night.
I was able to relax enough to get some sleep.\e

\h(«Aika»)I know we can beat Galcian. I have faith in
everyone… And I have faith in you.\e

\h(«Aika»)I'd face anyone if you were fighting by my side.
I'm sure the rest of the Air Pirates feel the
same way.\e

\h(«Aika»)Heh heh… Let's do our best.
Everyone's counting on you, Vy… I mean
Cap'n Vyse!!!\c

\h(«Aika»)Vyse, we really should head back to the port!
Everyone is waiting for you to lead us into 
battle!\c

\h(«Aika»)I thought everything would be over once we
defeated Galcian, but it looks like I was wrong,
huh?\e

\h(«Aika»)I'm not scared though, since you're 
here with me… and we've 
made it this far together, right?\e

\h(«Aika»)Ok, let's go beat the snot out of Ramirez so we 
can hurry back here to Crescent Isle, and throw 
the biggest party in history!\c

\h(«Fina»)It's… a very nice island. 
And you even had a room 
made for me, too.\e

\h(«Fina»)I can't believe it… I actually have my own room
in your home base…\e

\h(«Fina»)I feel like I am really a member of the Blue 
Rogues. I… I'm so happy. Thank you, Vyse.\e

\h(«Fina»)When we last saw him, Drachma said that
it wasn't going to be easy for him to
start his life over…\e

\h(«Fina»)Do you think he will rejoin us, 
when he feels better?\c

\h(«Fina»)We've finally gathered all of the Moon Crystals.
My mission is finally over.
Thank you for all your help.\c

\h(«Fina»)We can finally get into Deep Sky? 
I don't know much about it. 
I'm a little scared… \e

\h(«Fina»)I suppose it's time to look for my ship…
Thank you for all you've done for me…\c

\h(«Fina»)So, the Delphinus will be able to sail into
Deep Sky… I never dreamed that I'd have to go
down there.\c
\h(«Fina»)Enrique is going back to his homeland, Valua…\e

\h(«Fina»)I, too, must return to my homeland once we find
my ship. I… I feel almost as if I don't want to
return.\e

\h(«Fina»)I'm all right. I have decided that I can no
longer waste time lamenting over the change that
has occurred in Ramirez. He must be stopped.\e

\h(«Fina»)Ramirez and I… We were both raised by the
Elders in the Great Silver Shrine.\e

\h(«Fina»)Among the Elders, Elder Prime was the most
knowledgeable. He knew everything, from 
historical records to current world affairs.\e

\h(«Fina»)Ramirez was always the most interested in 
Elder Prime's stories about the Chronicles 
of Arcadia. They'd spend hours together.\e

\h(«Fina»)I think it was Elder Prime's stories that
inspired Ramirez to search for the Crystals. 
I can't believe Ramirez… killed him… \c

\h(«Fina»)Vyse, so many people were killed when 
the Rain of Destruction fell on Valua.\e

\h(«Fina»)Ramirez and the Silver Gigas, Zelos, are 
responsible for this.\e

\h(«Fina»)As a Silvite,
I… I should have stopped Ramirez… \c

\h(«Fina»)The time has come at last to face Ramirez.
To be completely honest, it… it's a little hard
for me to fight against him.\e

\h(«Fina»)But, as a Silvite… I must stop him. 
It is my duty. \e

\h(«Fina»)I'll do my best. We must not let
Galcian and Ramirez destroy this world.\c

\h(«Fina»)Galcian and Ramirez must be stopped, 
before more innocent lives are lost.\c

\h(«Fina»)Good morning, Vyse.
Um… thank you for everything last night.\e

\h(«Fina»)To be completely honest, it's a little hard for
me to fight against Ramirez. But…\e

\h(«Fina»)I want to fight. I want to help save this world.
I… I want to fight along side of you.\e

\h(«Fina»)That's why I'll try my best. As long as you are
there fighting with me, somehow I believe we'll
win.\c

\h(«Fina»)Let's go, Vyse. Everyone is probably waiting at
the Delphinus for us.\c
\h(«Fina»)Let's go Vyse, we've got to stop Ramirez. \e

\h(«Fina»)For the sake of this world… and for the memory
of Elder Prime, Ramirez must be stopped.\c

\h(«Enrique»)Hello, Vyse. For a hidden base, 
this is most impressive.\e

\h(«Enrique»)As we acquire more crew members, 
the base, as well as the Delphinus,
will run more smoothly.\e

\h(«Enrique»)You are the only one who has the experience 
and the determination to lead this crew to 
victory. We all look up to you, Vyse!\e

\h(«Enrique»)Vyse, I have entrusted you with the 
Delphinus. Please take good care of it,
I may want it back someday.\c

\h(«Enrique»)As a Prince of Valua, I knew that someday I 
would eventually return to Valua, but I never
thought I'd have to return from underneath it.\c

\h(«Enrique»)We have obtained all the Moon Crystals at last. 
Now I can finally put an end to my mother's
tyranny.\e

\h(«Enrique»)Although we fight on opposing sides,
she is still my mother.\e

\h(«Enrique»)I hope that I can convince her that what she is 
doing is wrong, and we can come to some
agreement.\c

\h(«Enrique»)Vyse… I'm sorry but could you leave me alone 
for a while?\e

\h(«Enrique»)The modifications on the Delphinus should be
complete. Let us return to the port, Vyse.\c

\h(«Enrique»)Don't give me that worried look of yours. 
I promise you that I will come back. 
Heh… I'm not quite ready to die yet.\e

\h(«Enrique»)I… I just have one request to ask of you, Vyse.
Please… look after Princess Moegi while I am
gone. She… she means so much to me.\c

\h(«Enrique»)So, it's time to confront Galcian. I shall 
accompany you in the Delphinus.\e

\h(«Enrique»)Galcian must pay for destroying my 
homeland, and killing my mother… 
and Gregorio…\c

\h(«Enrique»)This is it… If we win, the world will 
be at peace. We must win this battle!\e

\h(«Enrique»)Let's go, Vyse… No, Captain Vyse!
Lead us to victory!\c

\h(«Polly»)No está mal este sitio. Me recuerda un poco a mi
taberna de Isla Los Marinos.\e
\h(«Polly»)Creo que aquí puedo cocinar……\e

\h(«Polly»)Pero la cocina necesita unos arreglos.
Habrá que remodelarla, si no me será imposible
cocinar mis populares platos.\c

\h(«Polly»)Si me dejáis remodelar este sitio, puedo abrir
una taberna en esta isla.\c

situada! Es un buen punto de partida para buscar
todo tipo de aventuras.\e

¡Ni que el resto del mundo fuera tan grande!\e

\h(«Marco»)Después de tu pequeña charla, quiero conocer el
mundo entero. ¡Gracias, Vyse! ¡Estoy impaciente
por volver a navegar!\c

fue el cielo…… Es azul.
Nunca había visto el cielo azul……\e

\h(«Marco»)¡Y las nubes son blancas! ¡Creía que serían
oscuras como las de Valua!\e

\h(«Marco»)¡No os riáis! ¡Si hubierais estado en el Arrabal
de Valua toda vuestra vida, lo entenderíais!\c

\h(«Marco»)Eh…… Quién iba a pensar que me convertiría en
mecánico…… ¡He ayudado a construir eso!
Y la verdad, he hecho un buen trabajo.\c

\h(«Marco»)¡Bienvenido, Vyse! ¿A que te has sorprendido de
encontrar todo terminado en la isla?\e

\h(«Marco»)¡También le he ayudado mucho a Izmael! Bueno……
¡sólo he pintado las paredes, pero aun
así era mucho trabajo!\c

\h(«Marco»)Chicos, habéis visto las estrellas fugaces que
ha habido en Valua, ¿no?\e

\h(«Marco»)Desde entonces, Aika y tú parecéis tristes.
¿Qué pasa? ¿Ha ocurrido algo malo?\c

\h(«Marco»)La Armada hizo que las Piedras Lunares cayeran
sobre Valua, ¿es eso?\e

\h(«Marco»)No…… No me gustaba ese sitio, pero…… crecí allí.
Me entristece que haya desaparecido todo.\e

\h(«Marco»)Vyse, me tienes que prometer que venceremos a la
Armada. No podemos dejarles escapar después de
todo lo que han hecho.\c

\h(«Marco»)Tenemos que detenerles antes de que destruyan
los demás países. Aún me queda mucho por ver.\c

porvenir……\e

\h(«Kalifa»)¡¡¡Ahhh!!!\e

venden unos objetos raros.\e

\h(«Kalifa»)¡Así que, cuando vayáis por allí, pasaos de vez

\h(«Kalifa»)……¿Qué? ¡¿Que eso podría ser el futuro de

para que luchen en tu bando.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)Por otro lado, si siempre huyes de tus
adversarios, la gente hablará de tu
cobardía. Sé prudente en tus acciones.\c

viajes!\c
\h(«Kalifa»)…… Nada. No veo nada.\e

una inversión en tu futuro.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)¡Sí, sí! ¡Veo algo!\e

sentimientos de un corazón joven.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)¡Sí, sí! ¡Veo algo!
¡Veo un gran peligro en tu futuro inmediato!\e

\h(«Kalifa»)El mal adopta muchas formas,
pero en realidad…… no tiene ninguna.

\h(«Kalifa»)¡Sí, sí! ¡Veo algo!

\h(«Kalifa»)Oye, las adivinas también tenemos que
ganarnos la vida para comer.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)¡Sí, sí! ¡Veo algo!\e

terrible.\c

\h(«Kalifa»)La Luna Roja ha hablado. Recuérdalo siempre y te

\h(«Kalifa»)Lo siento mucho, pero no te llega el oro.

entorno.\c

\h(«Merida»)He oído que los miembros de la Familia Real de
Valua son crueles y que las gentes de Valua son
unos seres desalmados.\e

\h(«Merida»)Pero Enrique es muy simpático. Y Marco también
es mono. Creo que no se puede juzgar a la gente
sólo porque viene de otro país.\c

\h(«Hans»)Ahora mismo Brabham me está enseñando todo sobre
la construcción de barcos.\e

modelos viejos o nuevos, así que he aprendido
mucho! ¡Mi padre estaría orgulloso de mí!\e
\h(«Hans»)Me ha dejado leer el Libro del Polo Yafutoman.\e

tecnología del movimiento de las ondas y a
arreglar las velas a gran altitud!\c

trabajo. Brabham es muy estricto cuando se trata
de trabajo.\e

\h(«Hans»)Debe estar cansado después de tantas noches sin
dormir, pero no lo demuestra. ¡Tiene mucha
vitalidad para una persona de su edad!\e

\h(«Hans»)Bueno, nuestra base está mejor que nunca.
Ahora sólo tenemos que prepararnos para asaltar
Valua.\e

fabulosa tecnología para matar……\c

\h(«Hans»)Vyse……

cuando él no miraba.\c

\h(«Tikatika»)Nada nuevo hoy tampoco. Bueno, a excepción del

\h(«Tikatika»)Casi no puedo ver la isla que salió de

desierta, pensé que sería aún más deprimente que
Esperanza.\e

\h(«Don»)Pero aquí hay una gran variedad de comidas y
bebidas, y has formado una gran tripulación.

la Gruta Oscura. Y ahora estoy a punto de irme a
navegar hacia el submundo.\e

siento inspirado por ti no sería exagerar.\e

época, todos habríamos conseguido pasar por la
Gruta Oscura.\c

\h(«Don»)¡Me lo tienes que contar todo sobre el Gran
Relicario de Plata!\e

aquí rompiéndome las espaldas.\c

Piedras Lunares sobre Valua y luego hubo varias
explosiones.\e

\h(«Don»)Quiero olvidar el pasado, pero los Valuans
siguen preocupándome.

la fiesta será sonada!\e

\h(«Aika»)¡Eh! ¡Dije que a lo mejor! Lo he dicho con la

\h(«Vyse»)No me había dado cuenta de que también tienes un
lado sensible. Pero me gusta.\e

\h(«Aika»)……La única razón por la que no te habías dado
cuenta es porque cada vez que intento hablar
contigo, me tropiezo con la misma reacción.\e

\h(«Aika»)Estoy mucho mejor que antes. Gracias, Vyse.
Siempre te las arreglas para subirme la moral.\e

\h(«Aika»)A lo mejor es que estoy un poco tensa por la
batalla de mañana. Nos jugamos mucho en esa
batalla.\e

\h(«Aika»)Debería intentar relajarme. Lo haremos lo mejor
que podamos y lo que haya de pasar, pasará……\e

\h(«Vyse»)Sí.
Tú sólo actúa como siempre, Aika, y todo irá
bien.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Lo que tenemos que hacer es luchar, como hemos
hecho siempre……
¡Y hasta ahora nos ha ido muy bien!\e
\h(«Aika»)Claro que sí…… tienes razón.\e

\h(«Aika»)Me siento mucho mejor ahora. A lo mejor puedo
dormirme.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Muy bien……
Te veré mañana……\e
\h(«Aika»)……Vale.\e

\h(«Aika»)Muchas gracias, Vyse.
¡Vamos a hacer historia en la batalla de
mañana!\e

\h(«Aika»)¡Buenas noches!
¡Y no te levantes tarde mañana! Tu padre está
aquí…… ¿recuerdas?\e
\h(«Vyse»)Hé, Aika.\e
\h(«Aika»)Oh, Vyse.\e

\h(«Aika»)Tu parlais à Fina……
Comment va-t-elle ?\e

\h(«Vyse»)Elle avait l'air un peu inquiète par rapport à
demain……\e

\h(«Aika»)Hum……
Fina, aussi, hein ?\e

\h(«Aika»)Vyse ?
Que fais-tu debout si tard ?\e

\h(«Vyse»)C'est plutôt moi qui devrais te poser la
question ? Que fais-tu là ?\e

\h(«Aika»)Haha…… bien vu……
Je devrais répondre la première donc……\e

\h(«Aika»)Je ne sais pas……
Je me suis mise au lit, mais je ne pouvais pas
dormir.\e

\h(«Aika»)Peut-être que j'ai peur, tout simplement.
Hé…… Cela ne me ressemble pas, j'imagine……\e

\h(«Que direz-vous à Aika ?»)“Hé, moi aussi, j'ai peur.”
“Oui, cela ne te ressemble pas du tout……”\e

\h(«Vyse»)Hé, ne t'en fais pas. Moi aussi, j'ai peur.
La bataille de demain sera la plus dure que nous
ayons connue.\e

\h(«Aika»)Vraiment ?
Je ne croyais pas que tu pouvais avoir peur.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Ce n'est pas parce que je mène l'attaque de
demain que je n'ai plus peur de rien……\e

\h(«Aika»)Haha…… Je suis désolée.
Nous avons vécu tellement de choses. J'ai du mal
à me souvenir du gamin avec qui j'ai grandi.\e

\h(«Aika»)Ça va un peu mieux……
de savoir que je ne suis pas la seule à avoir
peur……\e

\h(«Aika»)L'avenir de ce monde se jouera dans la bataille
de demain…… C'est normal d'avoir peur.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Je ressens la même chose.
Je parie que Galcian a peur aussi.\e

\h(«Aika»)Hahaha !
Je parie que oui !\e

\h(«Vyse»)Oui, cela ne te ressemble pas. Tu devrais
peut-être te cacher sous ton lit.\e

\h(«Aika»)Hé ! J'ai dit peut-être ! Je n'ai pas vraiment
dit que j'avais peur. Et ce n'est pas la peine
de te moquer de moi.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Je ne savais pas que tu étais aussi sensible.
Mais je crois que cela me plaît.\e

\h(«Aika»)……Hé. Tu ne t'en es jamais rendu compte parce
que chaque fois que j'essaie de te parler,
tu réagis de cette façon.\e

\h(«Aika»)Ça commence à aller mieux. Merci Vyse.
Tu as toujours su me remonter le moral.\e

\h(«Aika»)Peut-être que c'est le stress de la bataille de
demain qui se fait sentir. L'avenir de ce monde
en dépend.\e

\h(«Aika»)Je devrais peut-être essayer de me détendre.
Nous ferons de notre mieux, ce qui doit arriver,
arrivera……\e

\h(«Vyse»)Oui.
Fais comme d'habitude, Aika, et tout ira bien.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Nous n'avons qu'à nous battre comme d'habitude……
Nous nous en sommes bien sortis jusqu'à
présent !\e
\h(«Aika»)Oui…… tu as raison.\e

\h(«Aika»)Je me sens beaucoup mieux maintenant. Peut-être
que j'arriverai à dormir.\e

\h(«Vyse»)D'accord……
À demain……\e
\h(«Aika»)……OK.\e

\h(«Aika»)Merci, Vyse.
Demain, nous entrons dans l'histoire !\e

\h(«Aika»)Bonne nuit !
Réveille-toi à l'heure ! Ton père est là……
tu te souviens ?\e
\h(«Vyse»)He, Aika.\e
\h(«Aika»)Oh, hallo, Vyse.\e

\h(«Aika»)Es sah so aus, als hättest du mit Fina
gesprochen…… wie geht es ihr?\e
\h(«Vyse»)Sie schien etwas besorgt wegen morgen……\e

\h(«Aika»)Hmm……
Sie also auch, wie?\e

\h(«Aika»)Vyse?
Warum bist du zu so später Stunde noch wach?\e

\h(«Vyse»)Das sollte ich dich fragen!
Was machst du hier draußen?\e

\h(«Aika»)Haha…… Gute Frage……
Ich nehme an, ich sollte zuerst antworten……\e

\h(«Aika»)Ich weiß nicht……
Ich bin ins Bett gekrochen, aber ich konnte
nicht schlafen.\e

\h(«Aika»)Vielleicht habe ich bloß Angst.
He…… Schätze, es sieht mir nicht ähnlich……\e

\h(«Was wirst du Aika sagen?»)“He, ich hab auch Angst”.
“Ja, das sieht dir gar nicht ähnlich……”\e

\h(«Vyse»)He, mach dir keine Sorgen. Ich habe auch Angst.
Morgen steht uns die schwerste Schlacht bevor,
die wir je hatten.\e

\h(«Aika»)Ach ja?
Ich hätte nicht gedacht, dass du es je mit der
Angst bekommst.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Nur weil man mich zum Anführer des morgigen
Angriffs gemacht hat, bedeutet noch lange nicht,
dass ich mich vor nichts mehr fürchte……\e

\h(«Aika»)Haha…… tut mir leid.
Wir haben so viel durchgemacht. Schätze, es
fällt mir schwer, dich noch als meinen kleinen
Spielkameraden zu sehen.\e

\h(«Aika»)Jetzt fühle ich mich schon besser……
weil ich hier nicht die Einzige bin, die
Angst hat……\e

\h(«Aika»)Von der morgigen Schlacht hängt sehr viel ab……
Ich denke, da ist es normal, Angst zu haben.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Du sagst es.
He, ich möchte wetten, Galcian hat auch Angst.\e

\h(«Aika»)Hahaha!
Mit Sicherheit!\e

\h(«Vyse»)Ja, das sieht dir gar nicht ähnlich. Vielleicht
solltest du dich unterm Bett
verstecken.\e

\h(«Aika»)He! Ich habe vielleicht gesagt! So war das auch
wieder nicht gemeint. Und du sollst dich nicht
lustig über mich machen.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Ich wusste gar nicht, dass du auch so sensibel
sein kannst. Aber es gefällt mir.\e

\h(«Aika»)……He, der einzige Grund, weshalb du das bisher
nicht gemerkt hast, ist, dass du jedesmal so
reagierst, wenn ich versuche, mit dir zu reden.\e

\h(«Aika»)Ich fühle mich schon etwas besser. Danke, Vyse.
du hast schon immer gewusst, wie du mich
aufmuntern kannst.\e

\h(«Aika»)Vielleicht ist das der Druck der morgigen
Schlacht. Es hängt viel davon ab.\e

\h(«Aika»)Vielleicht sollte ich mich ein wenig entspannen.
Wir werden unser Bestes tun, und was auch
immer passiert, das passiert……\e

\h(«Vyse»)Ja.
Sei einfach so, wie du immer bist, Aika, und
alles wird gut.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Wir müssen einfach so kämpfen, wie wir es
immer tun…… Bisher waren wir doch gar nicht so
schlecht!\e
\h(«Aika»)Ja…… du hast Recht.\e

\h(«Aika»)Ich fühle mich jetzt schon viel besser.
Vielleicht kann ich jetzt etwas schlafen.\e

\h(«Vyse»)In Ordnung……
Dann bis morgen……\e
\h(«Aika»)……Okay.\e

\h(«Aika»)Danke, Vyse.
Morgen werden wir in die Geschichte eingehen!\e

\h(«Aika»)Gute Nacht!
Du solltest aber nicht verschlafen! Du weißt
ja, dein Dad ist mit dabei……\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina…\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse…\e
\h(«Vyse»)Can't sleep?\e
\h(«Fina»)I… I tried to… but…\e
\h(«Fina»)…I couldn't stop thinking about Ramirez.\e

\h(«Fina»)I grew up with him…
My… my whole life, we were always together… 
We were best friends… \e

\h(«Fina»)It's… it's hard to think that now I'm going to
have to fight him… and one of us will die
tomorrow… \e
\h(«Fina»)As a Silvite, it is my duty, but… \e
\h(«Fina»)……\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina…\e

\h(«Fina»)Vyse.
I have…
I have one thing to ask of you…\e
\h(«Vyse»)What is it?\e

\h(«Fina»)Please…
Stay by my side…\e

\h(«Fina»)If you are at my side… during tomorrow's
battle… I know I'll be able to fight him.\e

\h(«Fina»)You're a great leader… I know you will inspire 
me… \e

\h(«What will you do?»)“Say comforting words.”
“Say nothing and just put your arm around her.”\e

\h(«Vyse»)Sure.
I'll be by your side.\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse… Thank you!\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina, I'll be there for you. This, I promise.\e
\h(«Vyse»)We'll fight together!\e
\h(«Fina»)…Yes.\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse…\e
\h(«Fina»)…Thank you.\e
\h(«Vyse»)…Feel better now?\e

\h(«Fina»)…Yes.
Having you here means a lot to me.\e
\h(«Fina»)Can we stay like this a little longer…?\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina……\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse……\e
\h(«Vyse»)¿No puedes dormir?\e
\h(«Fina»)Lo…… lo he intentado…… pero……\e
\h(«Fina»)……No podía dejar de pensar en Ramírez.\e

\h(«Fina»)Hemos crecido juntos……
Toda mi vida, siempre hemos estado juntos……
Él era mi mejor amigo……\e

\h(«Fina»)Es duro…… me resulta difícil pensar que voy a
tener que luchar contra él mañana…… y que uno de
los dos tendrá que morir……\e
\h(«Fina»)Como Silvite, es mi deber, pero……\e
\h(«Fina»)……\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina……\e

\h(«Fina»)Vyse.
Tengo que……
Tengo que pedirte una cosa……\e
\h(«Vyse»)¿Qué?\e

\h(«Fina»)Por favor……
Tienes que estar a mi lado……\e

\h(«Fina»)Si tengo tu apoyo…… en la batalla de mañana……
seré capaz de luchar contra él.\e

\h(«Fina»)Eres un gran líder……
Sé que vas a inspirarme……\e

\h(«¿Qué vas a hacer?»)“Darle palabras de aliento.”
“No decir nada y rodearla con el brazo.”\e

\h(«Vyse»)Claro.
Voy a estar a tu lado.\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse…… ¡Gracias!\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina, estaré a tu lado. Te lo prometo.\e
\h(«Vyse»)¡Lucharemos juntos!\e
\h(«Fina»)Sí……\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse……\e
\h(«Fina»)……Gracias.\e
\h(«Vyse»)…… ¿Ya te sientes mejor?\e

\h(«Fina»)……Sí.
Tenerte aquí significa mucho para mí.\e
\h(«Fina»)¿Podemos estar así un rato más……?\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina……\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse……\e
\h(«Vyse»)Tu ne peux pas dormir ?\e
\h(«Fina»)J'ai…… j'ai essayé…… mais……\e
\h(«Fina»)……Je n'arrêtais pas de penser à Ramirez.\e

\h(«Fina»)J'ai grandi avec lui……
Nous…… nous avons passé toute notre vie,
ensemble…… Il était mon meilleur ami……\e

\h(«Fina»)C'est…… c'est difficile de penser que je vais
devoir me battre contre lui…… et que l'un de
nous mourra demain……\e
\h(«Fina»)En tant que Silvite, c'est mon devoir, mais……\e
\h(«Fina»)……\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina……\e

\h(«Fina»)Vyse.
J'ai……
J'ai quelque chose à te demander……\e
\h(«Vyse»)Qu'est-ce que c'est ?\e

\h(«Fina»)S'il te plaît……
Reste à mes côtés……\e

\h(«Fina»)Si tu es à mes côtés…… pendant la bataille de
demain…… je sais que je pourrais me battre
contre lui.\e

\h(«Fina»)Tu es un leader formidable…… je sais que tu
m'inspireras……\e

\h(«Que ferez-vous ?»)“Vous parlez pour la réconforter.”
“Vous passez votre bras autour de sa taille.”\e

\h(«Vyse»)Bien sûr.
Je serais à tes côtés.\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse…… Merci !\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina, je serais là pour toi. Je te le promets.\e
\h(«Vyse»)Nous nous battrons ensemble !\e
\h(«Fina»)……Oui.\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse……\e
\h(«Fina»)……Merci.\e
\h(«Vyse»)……Ça va mieux maintenant ?\e

\h(«Fina»)……Oui.
C'est très important pour moi que tu sois là.\e

\h(«Fina»)Est-ce que l'on peut rester un petit moment
comme cela……?\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina……\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse……\e
\h(«Vyse»)Kannst du nicht schlafen?\e
\h(«Fina»)Ich…… ich hab's versucht,…… aber……\e
\h(«Fina»)……ich muss die ganze Zeit an Ramirez denken.\e

\h(«Fina»)Ich bin mit ihm aufgewachsen……
Mein…… mein ganzes Leben lang war ich mit
ihm zusammen…… wir waren die besten Freunde……\e

\h(«Fina»)Man…… man kann sich nur schwer vorstellen,
dass ich jetzt gegen ihn kämpfen muss……
und einer von uns morgen sterben wird……\e
\h(«Fina»)Als Silviterin ist es meine Pflicht, aber……\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina……\e

\h(«Fina»)Vyse.
Ich habe……
Ich habe da eine Bitte……\e
\h(«Vyse»)Was ist denn?\e

\h(«Fina»)Bitte……
Bleib bei mir……\e

\h(«Fina»)Wenn du bei mir bist…… morgen während der
Schlacht …… weiß ich, dass ich gegen
ihn kämpfen kann.\e

\h(«Fina»)Du bist ein großer Anführer…… ich weiß, du
wirst mich inspirieren……\e

\h(«Was wirst du machen?»)“Trostende Worte sagen”.
“Nichts sagen und deinen Arm um sie legen”.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Na klar.
Ich werde bei dir sein.\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse…… ich danke dir!\e

\h(«Vyse»)Fina, ich werde für dich da sein. Das
verspreche ich dir.\e
\h(«Vyse»)Wir werden gemeinsam kämpfen!\e
\h(«Fina»)……Ja.\e
\h(«Fina»)Vyse……\e
\h(«Fina»)……Danke.\e
\h(«Vyse»)……Geht es jetzt besser?\e

\h(«Fina»)……Ja.
Es ist so schön, dass du da bist.\e
\h(«Fina»)Können wir noch eine Weile so bleiben……?\e
